newsitem.title: USA: Mexico ups Aug Isthmus, Olmeca 10 cts for Americas.
newsitem.headline: Mexico ups Aug Isthmus, Olmeca 10 cts for Americas.

text.p: Mexico's state oil company Petrleos Mexicanos (Pemex) raised the August price differentials for Isthmus and Olmeca crude grades by 10 cts a barrel, and left the Maya differential unchanged for the Americas, trade sources said on Tuesday.

Pemex term crude contract prices are based on formulas comprised of weighted price ratios of crudes and products in the region with a constant, or differential, which is generally updated monthly to reflect market conditions.
Pemex raised the differential for Isthmus to $1.55 a barrel under the formula from $1.65 a barrel discount in July.
The Olmeca price diferential was increased to a discount of 35 cents from a 45-cent discount.
Maya remained unchanged at a discount of $2.60 a barrel.
"The increases surprised me with the threatened overhang of sour barrels," a Gilf Coast trader said.
U.S. sour grades have been dropping recently in reaction to the impending resumption of Iraqi exports and Monday's lifting of force majeure on Cao Limn exports in Colombia.
Pemex exported an average of 1.703 million barrels per day (bpd) of crude in June, with an average of 1.671 million bpd in the first six months of the year.
